title: Epochs do not update when training
body:
Hi! I have encountered an issue regarding the updating of training epochs, using train.py and the LJSpeech-1.1 dataset. I am unsure if training is even taking place, due to the lack of updates printed in the terminal.

I have followed the installation instructions in the readme, and have split the metadata.csv file as directed. Upon running the following command from the terminal in the TTS directory:
`sudo python3 train.py --config_path /home/dev/TTS/config.json`
I am presented with the following information in the terminal:

> Using CUDA:  True

   | > num_freq:1025
   | > power:1.5
   | > preemphasis:0.97
   | > griffin_lim_iters:30
   | > signal_norm:True
   | > symmetric_norm:False
   | > mel_fmin:0
   | > mel_fmax:None
   | > max_norm:1.0
   | > clip_norm:True
   | > do_trim_silence:True

 > Reading LJSpeech from - /home/dev/TTS/datasets/LJSpeech-1.1/

 | > Max length sequence 187
 | > Min length sequence 5
 | > Avg length sequence 98.23658333333333
 | > 0 instances are ignored by min_seq_len (0)
 | > Batch group shuffling is active.
 | > Epoch 0/5000

The only changes I had made to the config.json file are in respect to the data/output paths, and number of epochs (5000 in my case). After running train.py for around 30 min, no updates are printed in the terminal. However, running `nvidia-smi` indicates that my GPUs are still under load, despite the lack of updates to the epochs in the terminal:

Thanks!
